story.storykicker: Madhya Pradesh, Kendriya Vidyalaya students excel in board results declared by CBSE for class 10
story.storybody:
CBSE declared the results of class 10 students on Saturday, May 30, 2016. The Bhopal region that has 41 schools, made it to the top with the pass percentage of 99.89 that was more by 0.04 per cent last year. A total of 105 students from Kendriya Vidyalaya scored a 10 CGPA.

In Kendriya Vidyalaya-1 228 students had appeared for class 10 exams. Last year 286 students had appeared for class 10 boards out of which 29 scored 10 CGPA.

(Read: Stun by video, Bihar Board orders probe into the result of Class 12 toppers )

About students towards marks:

"Students have now become sensitive about their performances as there is a fight for every mark. I am happy to see students from our school who have given thier best performance among all KVs in Bhopal," said Principal, Saurabh Jaitley, KV-1 to TOI.

"Students, who have not achieved 10 CGPA should not feel bad. It is just an exam and they should strive for better performance, " he added.

(Read: Gujarat High Court dismisses 10 percent reservation for upper caste economically backwards )

Ranking of schools:

  • There were five Kendriya Vidyalayas out of which KV-1 (Maida Mill) gave the best performance. As many as 42 students from KV-1 scored 10 CGPA.
  • KV-2, Shivaji Nagar stood second with 23 students out of 177, who scored 10 CGPA.
  • KV-3, Bagsewania, was third which has 22 students out of 141, who scored 10 CGPA
  • KV-4, Bairagarh, stood fourth with 12 students scoring 10 CGPA out of the 147 students that appeared for the exam
  • The new Kendriya Vidyalaya that opened in Bangrasiya recently had 6 students with CGPA 10, out of the 34 that appeared

Overall, out of 3, 499 students that appeared for the exam this year, 3,495 were declared passed.

Click here for more updates on India Today Education
